subject: RE: [junit] How do I submit code which I think should be added to JUnit?
messageBody:
Correction received! Thanks. :)

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mathieu Gervais [mailto:egoine_@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 21, 2001 11:17 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] How do I submit code which I think
> should be added
> to JUnit?
>
>
> "They" *do* accept patches, especially clean code that
> comes with unit
> tests.
>
> (for example, see
> http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=4
> 02961&group_id=152
> 78&atid=315278)
>
> Maybe they are more conservative then say, JUnitX, or
> other projects but I
> think that is ok; their goal _seem_ to be more a simple
> and clean package
> than a feature packed one. That's the open-source way:
> everybody is able to
> pick what he needs.
>
> mathieu
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Brekke, Jeff
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Sent: Thursday, June 21, 2001 8:42 AM
> Subject: RE: [junit] How do I submit code which I think
> should be added to
> JUnit?
>
>
> What's the point of having the code in sourceforge if
> they don't except
> patches? Are most users using JUnitX because of this? I a little
> confused...
>
> -----------------------------------------------------------------
> Throw away my code, but never, never throw away my tests.
> -----------------------------------------------------------------
> Jeffrey D. Brekke Quad/Graphics
> Jeff.Brekke@... http://www.qg.com
> -----------------------------------------------------------------
>
>
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Jason Rogers [mailto:jason.rogers@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, June 21, 2001 7:22 AM
> > To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> > Subject: RE: [junit] How do I submit code which I think
> > should be added
> > to JUnit?
> >
> >
> > I forgot to include addresses. Kent's is
> > [mailto:kentbeck@...]. I
> > don't know Erich's.
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: Jason Rogers
> > > Sent: Thursday, June 21, 2001 7:31 AM
> > > To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> > > Subject: RE: [junit] How do I submit code which I think
> > > should be added
> > > to JUnit?
> > >
> > >
> > > As far as I know, Kent and Erich don't accept code for
> > > JUnit. They are, however, open to suggestions. I
> > > suggest emailing Kent or Erich directly.
> > >
> > > -Jason
> > >
> > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > From: Mike Duffy [mailto:mike.duffy@...]
> > > > Sent: Wednesday, June 20, 2001 5:05 PM
> > > > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > > > Subject: [junit] How do I submit code which I think
> > > > should be added to
> > > > JUnit?
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > Is JUnit open source?
> > > >
> > > > How do I submit code which I think should be
> > added to JUnit?
